body:
**ADMINS' ATTENTION PLEASE**, this is a major problem and needs to be attended as soon as possible!

I noticed a fundamental security flaw in the code that will allow me or anyone else to perform a guildmaster action in ANY guild!

Basically, the current check for if someone is a guildmaster relies on a post('action/guild_id/post_or_comment_id/value'), and it checks to make sure that you are a guildmaster of of the guild in `guild_id`. Almost every guildmaster action is verified this way.

But you can just use inspect element or the API to change the guild id to one you are a guildmaster of, thus enabling you GM permissions in ANY guild on the site!

I tested it and sure enough, I was able to herald a post on +UpliftingNews even though I'm not a guildmaster there: https://ruqqus.com/+UpliftingNews/post/5jlx/store-manager-buys-giant-teddy-bear

I just used inspect element on the herald button on a post in +foxes, and changed the post id to the one in +UpliftingNews. Since I am a GM of +foxes, the check passed and the post was heralded! I imagine this works for everything else too. The last thing I will do is herald this post to +Ruqqus so the admins will see it as soon as possible to fix this exploit. The rest of you don't hack anything in the meantime.

body:
Yep, I finally just looked through some things and wondered how this could be exploited. I was looking at the PR about pinning comments and noticed the guild was set by url, not the comment/post itself, so I looked to see if it could be manually altered and it could!

Fortunately most attempts result in an undefined error for the discrepancy, but certain actions (like heralding) are possible for anyone to do in any guild.

post.body:
**ADMINS' ATTENTION PLEASE**, this is a major problem and needs to be attended as soon as possible!

I noticed a fundamental security flaw in the code that will allow me or anyone else to perform a guildmaster action in ANY guild!

Basically, the current check for if someone is a guildmaster relies on a post('action/guild_id/post_or_comment_id/value'), and it checks to make sure that you are a guildmaster of of the guild in `guild_id`. Almost every guildmaster action is verified this way.

But you can just use inspect element or the API to change the guild id to one you are a guildmaster of, thus enabling you GM permissions in ANY guild on the site!

I tested it and sure enough, I was able to herald a post on +UpliftingNews even though I'm not a guildmaster there: https://ruqqus.com/+UpliftingNews/post/5jlx/store-manager-buys-giant-teddy-bear

I just used inspect element on the herald button on a post in +foxes, and changed the post id to the one in +UpliftingNews. Since I am a GM of +foxes, the check passed and the post was heralded! I imagine this works for everything else too. The last thing I will do is herald this post to +Ruqqus so the admins will see it as soon as possible to fix this exploit. The rest of you don't hack anything in the meantime.

post.body:
**ADMINS' ATTENTION PLEASE**, this is a major problem and needs to be attended as soon as possible!

I noticed a fundamental security flaw in the code that will allow me or anyone else to perform a guildmaster action in ANY guild!

Basically, the current check for if someone is a guildmaster relies on a post('action/guild_id/post_or_comment_id/value'), and it checks to make sure that you are a guildmaster of of the guild in `guild_id`. Almost every guildmaster action is verified this way.

But you can just use inspect element or the API to change the guild id to one you are a guildmaster of, thus enabling you GM permissions in ANY guild on the site!

I tested it and sure enough, I was able to herald a post on +UpliftingNews even though I'm not a guildmaster there: https://ruqqus.com/+UpliftingNews/post/5jlx/store-manager-buys-giant-teddy-bear

I just used inspect element on the herald button on a post in +foxes, and changed the post id to the one in +UpliftingNews. Since I am a GM of +foxes, the check passed and the post was heralded! I imagine this works for everything else too. The last thing I will do is herald this post to +Ruqqus so the admins will see it as soon as possible to fix this exploit. The rest of you don't hack anything in the meantime.

body:
Yeah I'm aware of that, but I'm only able to access discord on my phone since it permanently locks me out of my account if I try to log in on my computer, and typing all that out on mobile is just too hard. I figured the admins would see it in a few minutes and take the site down and fix it, which they did.

A bit off-topic but if you only told the admins, how did everyone else find out about the infinite coin exploit? I saw some talk about it on discord.

Also how did you know that giving negative coins would allow for getting infinite? 1) I would think that would actually count as negative and remove coins or not affect them, how did you just know that they'd turn positive? 2) And how were you able to tip yourself? 3) And even knowing they would turn positive, how did you know that the price wouldn't also? This bug I only found because it's super easy to spot, but something like negative coin values, especially with that many different possible scenarios, is much more difficult to figure out. How did you catch it?
body_html:
Yeah I'm aware of that, but I'm only able to access discord on my phone since it permanently locks me out of my account if I try to log in on my computer, and typing all that out on mobile is just too hard. I figured the admins would see it in a few minutes and take the site down and fix it, which they did.

A bit off-topic but if you only told the admins, how did everyone else find out about the infinite coin exploit? I saw some talk about it on discord.

Also how did you know that giving negative coins would allow for getting infinite? 1) I would think that would actually count as negative and remove coins or not affect them, how did you just know that they'd turn positive? 2) And how were you able to tip yourself? 3) And even knowing they would turn positive, how did you know that the price wouldn't also? This bug I only found because it's super easy to spot, but something like negative coin values, especially with that many different possible scenarios, is much more difficult to figure out. How did you catch it?

post.body:
**ADMINS' ATTENTION PLEASE**, this is a major problem and needs to be attended as soon as possible!

I noticed a fundamental security flaw in the code that will allow me or anyone else to perform a guildmaster action in ANY guild!

Basically, the current check for if someone is a guildmaster relies on a post('action/guild_id/post_or_comment_id/value'), and it checks to make sure that you are a guildmaster of of the guild in `guild_id`. Almost every guildmaster action is verified this way.

But you can just use inspect element or the API to change the guild id to one you are a guildmaster of, thus enabling you GM permissions in ANY guild on the site!

I tested it and sure enough, I was able to herald a post on +UpliftingNews even though I'm not a guildmaster there: https://ruqqus.com/+UpliftingNews/post/5jlx/store-manager-buys-giant-teddy-bear

I just used inspect element on the herald button on a post in +foxes, and changed the post id to the one in +UpliftingNews. Since I am a GM of +foxes, the check passed and the post was heralded! I imagine this works for everything else too. The last thing I will do is herald this post to +Ruqqus so the admins will see it as soon as possible to fix this exploit. The rest of you don't hack anything in the meantime.

body:
>Yeah I'm aware of that, but I'm only able to access discord on my phone since it permanently locks me out of my account if I try to log in on my computer

Ah, I see. In that case, maybe tag the admins, tell them you found something, and ask for a way to contact them without going on discord.

>A bit off-topic but if you only told the admins, how did everyone else find out about the infinite coin exploit? I saw some talk about it on discord.

I think it's ok to talk about these issues after they're fixed. Captainmeta4 wrote something in the announcements channel.

>I would think that would actually count as negative and remove coins or not affect them, how did you just know that they'd turn positive?

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/2a31c939ad8b1bd9e50452a1fee893ff33000353/ruqqus/routes/paypal.py#L304

` v.coin_balance -= coins`, where coins is the number of coins

>And how were you able to tip yourself?

I have several alt accounts. I tipped [this comment](https://ruqqus.com/+SomeGuild/post/3gn9/making-a-post-in-this-guild/j5r7).

>And even knowing they would turn positive, how did you know that the price wouldn't also?

You don't have to buy coins to tip them to comments.
body_html:
Yeah I'm aware of that, but I'm only able to access discord on my phone since it permanently locks me out of my account if I try to log in on my computer

Ah, I see. In that case, maybe tag the admins, tell them you found something, and ask for a way to contact them without going on discord.

A bit off-topic but if you only told the admins, how did everyone else find out about the infinite coin exploit? I saw some talk about it on discord.

I think it's ok to talk about these issues after they're fixed. Captainmeta4 wrote something in the announcements channel.

I would think that would actually count as negative and remove coins or not affect them, how did you just know that they'd turn positive?

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/2a31c939ad8b1bd9e50452a1fee893ff33000353/ruqqus/routes/paypal.py#L304

v.coin_balance -= coins, where coins is the number of coins

And how were you able to tip yourself?

I have several alt accounts. I tipped this comment.

And even knowing they would turn positive, how did you know that the price wouldn't also?

You don't have to buy coins to tip them to comments.

Yeah I'm aware of that, but I'm only able to access discord on my phone since it permanently locks me out of my account if I try to log in on my computer, and typing all that out on mobile is just too hard. I figured the admins would see it in a few minutes and take the site down and fix it, which they did.

A bit off-topic but if you only told the admins, how did everyone else find out about the infinite coin exploit? I saw some talk about it on discord.

Also how did you know that giving negative coins would allow for getting infinite? 1) I would think that would actually count as negative and remove coins or not affect them, how did you just know that they'd turn positive? 2) And how were you able to tip yourself? 3) And even knowing they would turn positive, how did you know that the price wouldn't also? This bug I only found because it's super easy to spot, but something like negative coin values, especially with that many different possible scenarios, is much more difficult to figure out. How did you catch it?

post.body:
**ADMINS' ATTENTION PLEASE**, this is a major problem and needs to be attended as soon as possible!

I noticed a fundamental security flaw in the code that will allow me or anyone else to perform a guildmaster action in ANY guild!

Basically, the current check for if someone is a guildmaster relies on a post('action/guild_id/post_or_comment_id/value'), and it checks to make sure that you are a guildmaster of of the guild in `guild_id`. Almost every guildmaster action is verified this way.

But you can just use inspect element or the API to change the guild id to one you are a guildmaster of, thus enabling you GM permissions in ANY guild on the site!

I tested it and sure enough, I was able to herald a post on +UpliftingNews even though I'm not a guildmaster there: https://ruqqus.com/+UpliftingNews/post/5jlx/store-manager-buys-giant-teddy-bear

I just used inspect element on the herald button on a post in +foxes, and changed the post id to the one in +UpliftingNews. Since I am a GM of +foxes, the check passed and the post was heralded! I imagine this works for everything else too. The last thing I will do is herald this post to +Ruqqus so the admins will see it as soon as possible to fix this exploit. The rest of you don't hack anything in the meantime.

post.body:
**ADMINS' ATTENTION PLEASE**, this is a major problem and needs to be attended as soon as possible!

I noticed a fundamental security flaw in the code that will allow me or anyone else to perform a guildmaster action in ANY guild!

Basically, the current check for if someone is a guildmaster relies on a post('action/guild_id/post_or_comment_id/value'), and it checks to make sure that you are a guildmaster of of the guild in `guild_id`. Almost every guildmaster action is verified this way.

But you can just use inspect element or the API to change the guild id to one you are a guildmaster of, thus enabling you GM permissions in ANY guild on the site!

I tested it and sure enough, I was able to herald a post on +UpliftingNews even though I'm not a guildmaster there: https://ruqqus.com/+UpliftingNews/post/5jlx/store-manager-buys-giant-teddy-bear

I just used inspect element on the herald button on a post in +foxes, and changed the post id to the one in +UpliftingNews. Since I am a GM of +foxes, the check passed and the post was heralded! I imagine this works for everything else too. The last thing I will do is herald this post to +Ruqqus so the admins will see it as soon as possible to fix this exploit. The rest of you don't hack anything in the meantime.

post.body:
**ADMINS' ATTENTION PLEASE**, this is a major problem and needs to be attended as soon as possible!

I noticed a fundamental security flaw in the code that will allow me or anyone else to perform a guildmaster action in ANY guild!

Basically, the current check for if someone is a guildmaster relies on a post('action/guild_id/post_or_comment_id/value'), and it checks to make sure that you are a guildmaster of of the guild in `guild_id`. Almost every guildmaster action is verified this way.

But you can just use inspect element or the API to change the guild id to one you are a guildmaster of, thus enabling you GM permissions in ANY guild on the site!

I tested it and sure enough, I was able to herald a post on +UpliftingNews even though I'm not a guildmaster there: https://ruqqus.com/+UpliftingNews/post/5jlx/store-manager-buys-giant-teddy-bear

I just used inspect element on the herald button on a post in +foxes, and changed the post id to the one in +UpliftingNews. Since I am a GM of +foxes, the check passed and the post was heralded! I imagine this works for everything else too. The last thing I will do is herald this post to +Ruqqus so the admins will see it as soon as possible to fix this exploit. The rest of you don't hack anything in the meantime.

body:
My friend. Would it be like this unshakable feeling of being on a stage. 
  
Like theres an audience watching, but you know there isnt. Life isnt a tv show. 
  
Yet almost feels like shit around you is orchestrated. Like events in a game only triggering when you are near.
  
Feels like the world dosent exist when you arent there to see it. 
  
That its all a show trying to deceive you.
  
That kind of feeling?

post.body:
**ADMINS' ATTENTION PLEASE**, this is a major problem and needs to be attended as soon as possible!

I noticed a fundamental security flaw in the code that will allow me or anyone else to perform a guildmaster action in ANY guild!

Basically, the current check for if someone is a guildmaster relies on a post('action/guild_id/post_or_comment_id/value'), and it checks to make sure that you are a guildmaster of of the guild in `guild_id`. Almost every guildmaster action is verified this way.

But you can just use inspect element or the API to change the guild id to one you are a guildmaster of, thus enabling you GM permissions in ANY guild on the site!

I tested it and sure enough, I was able to herald a post on +UpliftingNews even though I'm not a guildmaster there: https://ruqqus.com/+UpliftingNews/post/5jlx/store-manager-buys-giant-teddy-bear

I just used inspect element on the herald button on a post in +foxes, and changed the post id to the one in +UpliftingNews. Since I am a GM of +foxes, the check passed and the post was heralded! I imagine this works for everything else too. The last thing I will do is herald this post to +Ruqqus so the admins will see it as soon as possible to fix this exploit. The rest of you don't hack anything in the meantime.

Basically, the current check for if someone is a guildmaster relies on a post('action/guild_id/post_or_comment_id/value'), and it checks to make sure that you are a guildmaster of of the guild in `guild_id`. Almost every guildmaster action is verified this way.

But you can just use inspect element or the API to change the guild id to one you are a guildmaster of, thus enabling you GM permissions in ANY guild on the site!

I tested it and sure enough, I was able to herald a post on +UpliftingNews even though I'm not a guildmaster there: https://ruqqus.com/+UpliftingNews/post/5jlx/store-manager-buys-giant-teddy-bear

I just used inspect element on the herald button on a post in +foxes, and changed the post id to the one in +UpliftingNews. Since I am a GM of +foxes, the check passed and the post was heralded! I imagine this works for everything else too. The last thing I will do is herald this post to +Ruqqus so the admins will see it as soon as possible to fix this exploit. The rest of you don't hack anything in the meantime.

body: Well to be fair this one was *really* easy to spot. It was staring me right in the face that the board id was set by the url of the POST request. More subtle (but often grave) bugs, such as negative values for coins getting subtracted and allowing you to have infinite, I rarely if ever spot. The problem is I have trouble thinking of unconventional scenarios, and even when I do I have trouble executing them in my head. Though others can mentally see pretty much everything and find them all the time.

post.body:
**ADMINS' ATTENTION PLEASE**, this is a major problem and needs to be attended as soon as possible!

I noticed a fundamental security flaw in the code that will allow me or anyone else to perform a guildmaster action in ANY guild!

Basically, the current check for if someone is a guildmaster relies on a post('action/guild_id/post_or_comment_id/value'), and it checks to make sure that you are a guildmaster of of the guild in `guild_id`. Almost every guildmaster action is verified this way.

But you can just use inspect element or the API to change the guild id to one you are a guildmaster of, thus enabling you GM permissions in ANY guild on the site!

I tested it and sure enough, I was able to herald a post on +UpliftingNews even though I'm not a guildmaster there: https://ruqqus.com/+UpliftingNews/post/5jlx/store-manager-buys-giant-teddy-bear

I just used inspect element on the herald button on a post in +foxes, and changed the post id to the one in +UpliftingNews. Since I am a GM of +foxes, the check passed and the post was heralded! I imagine this works for everything else too. The last thing I will do is herald this post to +Ruqqus so the admins will see it as soon as possible to fix this exploit. The rest of you don't hack anything in the meantime.
